column1: comment
I love having so many original shows to choose from. The variety keeps me subscribed month after month, and I've recommended the service to several friends who also enjoy binge-watching new series.
The app on my smart TV loads slowly and sometimes crashes mid-episode. It's frustrating to lose my place in a show, especially when I'm watching something intense with cliffhangers.
For the price I pay, the content library is excellent. There's always something new to watch, whether I'm in the mood for documentaries, comedies, or drama series.
I wish the recommendation algorithm was smarter. It keeps suggesting shows I've already watched or genres I have zero interest in. The browse experience could be much better.
The streaming quality is fantastic on my fiber connection. 4K content looks incredible, and I rarely experience buffering even during peak evening hours.
Customer service was helpful when I had billing questions. They resolved my issue quickly and even gave me a credit for the inconvenience I experienced.
The kids' section is well organized and gives me peace of mind as a parent. I can set up profiles with appropriate content restrictions easily.
I cancelled after the last price increase. The content is good but not good enough to justify paying more than I pay for other similar services.
Download feature works great for my commute. I can save episodes to watch offline on the train without using mobile data.
The interface redesign made it harder to find my watchlist. Why do companies keep changing things that already work well?
Original movies have been disappointing lately. They feel low-budget compared to theatrical releases, and the writing quality varies wildly.
I appreciate the diverse content from different countries. International shows with subtitles have introduced me to storytelling styles I never knew I'd enjoy.
Autoplay previews are annoying. I just want to browse quietly without having trailers blast at me every time I pause on a title.
The family sharing plan is great value. Four screens simultaneously means everyone in my household can watch what they want without conflicts.
Search functionality needs improvement. Half the time I can't find shows I know exist on the platform until I Google the exact title.
Picture quality dropped noticeably after the compression changes. I'm paying for premium but the image doesn't look as sharp as before.
The continue watching row is helpful but often shows episodes I've already finished. Syncing across devices doesn't always work correctly.
New releases come out every week which keeps things fresh. I never run out of new content to explore on weekends.
The app drains my phone battery quickly even when running in the background. Needs optimization for mobile devices.
I've discovered so many hidden gems through the trending section. It's become my go-to way to find popular shows I might have missed.
Closed captions are accurate and well-timed. As someone who watches with subtitles, I really appreciate the attention to accessibility.
The pricing tiers are confusing. I'm never sure which plan I need or what features I'm actually getting for what I pay.
Audio quality in surround sound is phenomenal. The Atmos tracks on certain shows make my home theater sound amazing.
Too many shows get cancelled after one season. I'm hesitant to invest time in new series because they might not get renewed.
The watchlist organization could use folders or categories. When you have dozens of saved shows, scrolling through a single list is tedious.
Streaming on multiple devices at once is seamless. I can start watching on my phone and switch to the TV without losing my place.
The documentary selection is outstanding. There's always something educational and well-produced to watch when I want to learn something new.
Login issues happen too frequently. I get logged out randomly and have to re-enter my password on all my devices.
Skip intro button is a lifesaver for binge-watching. Small feature but it saves so much time over a long series.
I miss when the service had a larger classic movie library. The focus on originals seems to have come at the expense of older content.
The personalized daily picks feature actually works well for me. It surfaces shows that match my taste better than the main browse page.
App performance on older devices is poor. My three-year-old tablet struggles to run the app smoothly even though it handles other streaming apps fine.
The originals feel increasingly formulaic. Everything follows the same eight-episode format and similar storytelling beats.
Customer support response times have improved dramatically. Issues that used to take days to resolve now get fixed within hours.
The recently added section helps me stay current with new arrivals. I check it weekly to see what content just dropped.
Picture-in-picture mode on mobile is fantastic. I can browse other apps while keeping my show playing in a corner of the screen.
Content warnings before episodes are appreciated. It helps me decide whether to watch something with my kids in the room.
The interface is cluttered with too many rows and categories. I want a simpler, cleaner design that doesn't overwhelm me with choices.
Live streaming quality during premieres is hit or miss. Big event releases sometimes buffer badly in the first hour.
I love the behind-the-scenes extras for original productions. Getting insights into how shows are made adds value to the subscription.
The recommendation system improved after I rated more shows. Initially it was generic but now it understands my preferences better.
Too much content I'm not interested in clutters my home screen. Give me more control over what categories appear prominently.
Audio description tracks for visually impaired users work well. My grandmother can enjoy shows with me now.
The content library feels smaller than competitors. I often search for movies and find they're only available elsewhere.
Smooth casting to Chromecast makes setup effortless. One tap and I'm watching on the big screen.
Episode recaps are helpful for shows with complex storylines. When I return after a few weeks, the 'previously on' saves me from rewatching.
The service needs more stand-up comedy specials. Other platforms have more variety in this category.
Creating separate profiles for each family member works perfectly. Everyone's recommendations stay relevant to their tastes.
I appreciate the transparent pricing with no hidden fees. What I see is what I pay, no surprises on my bill.
Download limits are restrictive. I wish I could save more content for long flights without having to pick and choose so carefully.
The new gaming integration feels gimmicky. I subscribed for video content, not mobile games I'll never play.
Content rotation is frustrating. Shows I was planning to watch sometimes disappear before I get to them.
The interface remembers my language preferences across all devices. Small touch but it shows attention to user experience.
Password sharing crackdown feels unfair to families who live apart. My college-age kids can't access our family account anymore.
Audio sync issues plague certain devices. The words don't match the lip movements, which is distracting and annoying.
The platform handles slow connections gracefully. Quality drops smoothly rather than constant buffering stops.
New user interface updates are pushed without warning. I log in and suddenly everything has moved to different places.
The credits skip feature is useful but sometimes cuts off post-credit scenes. Let me choose when to skip.
Regional content restrictions make no sense in today's world. Shows available in other countries aren't available where I live.
Weekly episode releases build anticipation better than dropping entire seasons. I actually enjoy the waiting and discussion.
The mobile app could use dark mode options. The bright interface is harsh when watching at night.
Content partnership announcements get me excited about upcoming additions. I love knowing what's coming next quarter.
The service handles multiple languages well. Switching between audio tracks and subtitle languages is intuitive.
I'd pay more for an ad-supported free tier that gave me access to everything. Current pricing forces me to pick just one service.
The parental control PIN system is easy to set up but robust enough that kids can't easily bypass it.
Customer service chat bots are frustrating. I want to talk to a real person when I have an actual problem.
The overall value proposition makes this my primary streaming service. Good content, fair price, reliable technology.
Library organization by genre could be more specific. 'Drama' is too broad a category to be useful for browsing.
The recently watched history helps me find shows I forgot the names of. Small feature but I use it often.
International voice dubbing quality varies wildly. Some shows have excellent dubs, others feel phoned in.
The platform's commitment to original content creation justifies my subscription. Exclusive shows I can't get elsewhere keep me loyal.
Early renewal discounts for annual subscribers would be appreciated. Reward customer loyalty with better pricing.
The browsing experience on gaming consoles is clunky. Navigation feels designed for phone screens, not TV remotes.
Content moderation and age ratings seem inconsistent across titles. Similar shows have different ratings for no apparent reason.
